While you can access a container from within the cluster, one can use a NodePort to NAT trafﬁc from outside the cluster. One reason to deploy a NodePort instead, is that a LoadBalancer is also a load balancer resource from cloud providers like GKE and AWS.

#expose the deployment usingthe--type=NodePort. Wewillalsogiveitaneasytoremembernameandplaceitintheaccountingnamespace. We could pass the port as well, which could help with opening ports in the ﬁrewall

$ kubectl -n accounting expose deployment nginx-one --type=NodePort --name=service-lab

#details of the service. looking for autogenerated port
$ kubectl -n accounting describe services

# this is a great command that will show kube master URL
$ kubectl cluster-info
